[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_utils.move] [Alternative] [Exponentiation Method] Instead of iterative multiplication/division by 10, could pow(10, diff) be used? Would this be safer or introduce new overflow risks? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_utils.move] [Alternative] [Fixed-Point Library] Should this module use a battle-tested fixed-point math library instead of custom implementations? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_utils.move] [Line 11-19] [Loop Condition] The while loop checks 'decimal != target_decimal && value != 0'. If value becomes 0 during iteration (impossible with current logic but could happen with future modifications), the loop exits early. Can this create incorrect partial conversions? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_utils.move] [Line 47] [Address Max Usage] Using sui::address::max() instead of u256::MAX for overflow detection is unusual. Can this create a security vulnerability where values larger than address::max() but smaller than u256::MAX pass the check but still overflow? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_utils.move] [Line 51] [Multiple Division] The division by 'a' happens after multiplication by constants::multiple(). If 'a' is very small (but non-zero), can this create extremely large amplitude values that then get clamped to U64MAX, losing important information? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_utils.move] [Line 56] [Cast Safety] The final cast (amplitude as u64) assumes amplitude <= U64MAX after the check on line 52. But can any logic path reach line 56 with amplitude > U64MAX? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_utils.move] [Overflow] [Chained Conversions] If a value is converted from decimal A to B, then B to C, can the intermediate conversions accumulate overflow risks that wouldn't exist in a direct A to C conversion? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_utils.move] [Overflow] [Multiple Scaling] In calculate_amplitude(), the multiplication by constants::multiple() could overflow even if ab_diff alone doesn't. Is the overflow check on line 47 sufficient for all possible values of constants::multiple()? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_utils.move] [Overflow] [U256 Limits] While u256 is very large, can specific combinations of max values in decimal conversion cause overflow in intermediate calculations before the final result? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_utils.move] [Missing Feature] [Reverse Conversion] There's no function to reverse a decimal conversion. Can this lead to inconsistencies where forward and backward conversions don't match? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_utils.move] [Missing Feature] [Conversion Validation] There's no function to validate that a conversion was correct. Can corrupted conversions go undetected? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_utils.move] [Missing Feature] [Batch Conversion] For multiple price conversions, no batch function exists. Can this lead to consistency issues when prices need to be converted atomically? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_utils.move] [Module Dependency] [Constants Module] The module depends on oracle::oracle_constants for the multiple() value. If that module has vulnerabilities or can be upgraded maliciously, can it compromise amplitude calculations? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_utils.move] [Module Dependency] [Sui Address Module] The dependency on sui::address::max() is unusual for math operations. Can updates to the Sui standard library change this value and break amplitude overflow checks? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_utils.move] [Final Vector] [Oracle Manipulation Combined with Decimal Exploit] Can an attacker manipulate external oracle prices to specific values that, when processed through these decimal conversions with carefully chosen decimals, result in favorable rounding that enables vault drainage? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_utils.move] [Final Vector] [Amplitude Threshold Gaming] If the vault uses amplitude to reject suspicious price updates, can an attacker learn the exact threshold and keep manipulated prices just below it to avoid detection while stealing value? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_utils.move] [Final Vector] [Decimal Confusion in Multi-Asset Vault] In a vault with multiple assets using different native decimals, can an attacker exploit conversion errors to make one asset appear more valuable than another, enabling unfavorable swaps? (High)
